value.name: client
value.description: error on the client side unrelated to the pam authentication itself

s2c.name: response_channel

description.summary: Send the pam response file descriptor

s2c.description:
The server must send this file descriptor immediatly. It is then used to send password or other authentication prompt responses to the conversation.
This is done via a seperate fd because it allows the pam process to block reading it.

arg.name: messageFd
arg.summary: filedescriptor used to read the authentication response from

s2c.name: destroy

description.summary: We are done here. Make the client exit.

s2c.description: The server may decide to send this at any time. The client is expected to exit gracefully.

object.name: pam_conversation_v1
object.description: This object represents a pam conversation over the wire.

s2c.name: start
s2c.description: The server sends this to start an authentication try. It is a protocol error to send another start request, before start/fail was send by the client.

c2s.name: pam_prompt

description.summary: Submit PAM_PROMPT_ECHO_OFF or PAM_PROMPT_ECHO_ON obtained from the pam convo

c2s.description: PAM_PROMPT_ECHO_OFF or PAM_PROMPT_ECHO_ON messages directly from pam.

description.summary: Submit PAM_TEXT_INFO obtained from the pam convo
Submit PAM_ERROR_MSG obtained from the pam convo

c2s.name: success
c2s.description: Success event from the pam client. The server must ignore this in case token_bytes does not match the corresponding provider token on the server side.

c2s.name: fail
c2s.description: Failure event from the pam client. The server must ignore this in case token_bytes does not match the corresponding provider token on the server side.
